instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVE]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Reboots randomly sometimes continuously.
threads.message:
I repaired this laptop probably over a year ago with a minor liquid spill.

The thing is just rebooting. Sometimes it will stay up for 30minutes but usually it continuously chimes. It seems it is losing power as the backlight goes out and the fan stops spinning then it powers back up and goes again.

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> both maintain their readings through a restarts although once I saw <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> slowly count down from 3.375 till it rebooted at close to 0.

threads.title: [SOLVE]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Reboots randomly sometimes continuously.
threads.message: Crap under SMC, trackpad flatcable.. could be anywhere

threads.title: [SOLVE]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Reboots randomly sometimes continuously.
threads.message:
Reluctantly ultrasonic'ed the board and it seems to be stable now. Ran ASD on loop for a couple hours with no problems.

Mark solved please.
